links.body: Sozin's Comet, Part 3: Into the Inferno

paragraphs.body: Lo and Li were ${link_0} ${link_1}'s two elderly advisers. They were focused people who contributed to Azula's insatiable thirst for power. Although not ${link_2} themselves, they served as mentors for Azula's ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: Lo and Li were Princess Azula's two elderly advisers. They were focused people who contributed to Azula's insatiable thirst for power. Although not firebenders themselves, they served as mentors for Azula's firebending training.

paragraphs.body: Lo and Li had been coming to their beach cottage in Ember Island since they were infants and once their parents died, they inherited the building. When life in the ${link_0} became too hectic, the twins escaped there in order to relax. Lo and Li were both appointed as Azula's firebending mentors when she was a child.
paragraphs.text: Lo and Li had been coming to their beach cottage in Ember Island since they were infants and once their parents died, they inherited the building. When life in the Fire Nation Capital became too hectic, the twins escaped there in order to relax. Lo and Li were both appointed as Azula's firebending mentors when she was a child.

paragraphs.body: During 100 ${link_0}, they accompanied the Fire Nation princess on her journey to the ${link_1} to retrieve Prince ${link_2}. After the prince managed to escape, Lo and Li advised Azula to abandon the ${link_3} in favor of a smaller elite group to better increase her chances of capturing her fugitive brother and ${link_4}.
paragraphs.text: During 100 AG, they accompanied the Fire Nation princess on her journey to the Earth Kingdom to retrieve Prince Zuko. After the prince managed to escape, Lo and Li advised Azula to abandon the Royal Procession in favor of a smaller elite group to better increase her chances of capturing her fugitive brother and uncle.

paragraphs.body: The duo later presided over a rally held at the Fire Nation Capital's ${link_0}, where they boastfully declared victory over the Earth Kingdom due to the efforts of Azula and the newly returned Prince Zuko.
paragraphs.text: The duo later presided over a rally held at the Fire Nation Capital's Royal Plaza, where they boastfully declared victory over the Earth Kingdom due to the efforts of Azula and the newly returned Prince Zuko.

paragraphs.body: Later, Zuko, ${link_0}, ${link_1}, and Azula stayed with the sisters on ${link_2} where they owned their small but comfortable beach house. While sharing a meal with the teenagers, the sisters mentioned that the beach had special "powers" and that it supposedly changed people, smoothing even the roughest edges. After sharing this wisdom, they clapped their hands and announced that they were going to the beach, removing their outer garments, much to the displeasure and disgust of the others. Later on, Lo and Li further introduced the island to the teenagers, bringing them to an arcade in the hopes of getting them to have some fun.
paragraphs.text: Later, Zuko, Mai, Ty Lee, and Azula stayed with the sisters on Ember Island where they owned their small but comfortable beach house. While sharing a meal with the teenagers, the sisters mentioned that the beach had special "powers" and that it supposedly changed people, smoothing even the roughest edges. After sharing this wisdom, they clapped their hands and announced that they were going to the beach, removing their outer garments, much to the displeasure and disgust of the others. Later on, Lo and Li further introduced the island to the teenagers, bringing them to an arcade in the hopes of getting them to have some fun.

paragraphs.body: Much later, after Fire Lord ${link_0} appointed himself as the ${link_1}, Lo and Li appeared to Azula, who was to be coronated as Fire Lord. In light of her frantic purging of the ${link_2} ${link_3}, they expressed their concern for Azula's welfare and suggested postponing her coronation. However, the princess misinterpreted their remark as having lack of faith in her abilities to rule, and consequently ordered the twins to fight an ${link_4}. Upon remarking that they were not firebenders, Azula promptly banished Lo. However, since the princess pointed at Li while giving the order, the twin sisters were left in confusion as to who was banished and who was allowed to remain at the palace.
paragraphs.text: Much later, after Fire Lord Ozai appointed himself as the Phoenix King, Lo and Li appeared to Azula, who was to be coronated as Fire Lord. In light of her frantic purging of the Royal Palace staff, they expressed their concern for Azula's welfare and suggested postponing her coronation. However, the princess misinterpreted their remark as having lack of faith in her abilities to rule, and consequently ordered the twins to fight an Agni Kai. Upon remarking that they were not firebenders, Azula promptly banished Lo. However, since the princess pointed at Li while giving the order, the twin sisters were left in confusion as to who was banished and who was allowed to remain at the palace.

paragraphs.body: The small triangle that was present on both Lo and Li's hair bands is the alchemical symbol for fire.
paragraphs.text: The small triangle that was present on both Lo and Li's hair bands is the alchemical symbol for fire.

paragraphs.body: Lo and Li are one of five pairs of twins in either series, with ${link_0}, ${link_1}, ${link_2}, and ${link_3} and his brother being the other four. However, they are the only pair of twins to both be nonbenders.
paragraphs.text: Lo and Li are one of five pairs of twins in either series, with Poi and Ping, Desna and Eska, Wei and Wing, and Hundun and his brother being the other four. However, they are the only pair of twins to both be nonbenders.

paragraphs.body: Lo and Li are the only pair of sisters to be seen in ${link_0} and the first in the Avatar series.
paragraphs.text: Lo and Li are the only pair of sisters to be seen in Avatar: The Last Airbender and the first in the Avatar series.

paragraphs.body: Lo and Li are the first known bending teachers who were nonbenders, the second being ${link_0}, though, unlike Lo and Li, he used to be a bender.
paragraphs.text: Lo and Li are the first known bending teachers who were nonbenders, the second being Yakone, though, unlike Lo and Li, he used to be a bender.

paragraphs.body: Lo and Li were said to have driven the ${link_0} used by ${link_1} to pursue ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Lo and Li were said to have driven the tank train used by Azula's team to pursue Team Avatar.
